keyMoments.title: Sabo Finds the Telescope
keyMoments.description: Sabo discovers a telescope that Luffy wanted but is immediately surrounded by the Bluejam Pirates who know his noble identity.
keyMoments.significance: The telescope becomes a powerful symbol of Sabo's dreams and his bond with his brothers.

keyMoments.title: Sabo's Sacrifice for His Brothers
keyMoments.description: Sabo tearfully agrees to return with his father, sacrificing his freedom and dreams to protect Ace and Luffy from being killed by Bluejam.
keyMoments.significance: Defines Sabo's character as someone willing to sacrifice everything for his brothers, showing the depth of their bond.

keyMoments.title: Discovery of the Gray Terminal Fire Plot
keyMoments.description: Sabo learns from Sterry about the nobles' plan to burn Gray Terminal and everyone in it to prepare for a World Noble's visit.
keyMoments.significance: This revelation drives Sabo to escape and attempt to save his brothers and the residents of Gray Terminal.

keyMoments.title: Sabo Escapes to Warn His Brothers
keyMoments.description: Despite having just been forced back home, Sabo immediately escapes to warn Ace and Luffy about the impending fire.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Sabo's courage and determination, willing to risk everything again for his brothers.

relationships.description: Sabo considers Luffy his sworn brother and is willing to sacrifice his freedom to protect him.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo sacrifices his freedom by agreeing to return with his father to save Luffy and Ace from being killed.

relationships.description: Sabo considers Ace his sworn brother and is willing to sacrifice his freedom to protect him.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo sacrifices his freedom by agreeing to return with his father to save Ace and Luffy from being killed.

relationships.description: Outlook III is Sabo's biological father, though Sabo despises him and his noble values.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III forces Sabo to return home by threatening his brothers' lives.

relationships.description: Sterry is Sabo's adopted brother, taken in to replace Sabo as the family heir.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo meets Sterry for the first time and learns about the Gray Terminal fire from him.

reveals.information: Sabo discovers the nobles' plan to burn Gray Terminal and all its inhabitants for the sake of appearances

keyMoments.title: Sterry's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Sterry appears for the first time as the boy adopted by Outlook III to replace Sabo as the family heir.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a character who will later become the King of Goa Kingdom, showing the calculating nature of noble families.

keyMoments.title: Sterry Reveals the Fire Plot
keyMoments.description: Sterry cryptically reveals to Sabo that the nobles plan to burn Gray Terminal to 'clean' the country.
keyMoments.significance: Sterry's casual revelation of this genocidal plan shows his complete acceptance of noble cruelty.
keyMoments.quote: If there is a fire at the Gray Terminal, then this country will be clean.

relationships.description: Sterry is adopted to replace Sabo as heir to the Outlook family.

evolutionMoments.description: Sterry meets Sabo and reveals the Gray Terminal fire plot to him.

relationships.description: Outlook III adopted Sterry to be his heir when Sabo ran away.

reveals.information: Sterry is revealed to be calculating, elitist, and complicit with the nobles' cruel plans

keyMoments.title: Outlook III Forces Sabo to Return
keyMoments.description: Outlook III arrives at Gray Terminal with the Bluejam Pirates to forcibly retrieve his son Sabo, showing disgust when Ace's blood touches him.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the depths of noble prejudice and why Sabo despises his family and their values.
keyMoments.quote: You got your trashy kid's blood all over me!

relationships.description: Outlook III is Sabo's biological father who forces him back to noble life.

evolutionMoments.description: Outlook III hires the Bluejam Pirates to capture and retrieve Sabo from Gray Terminal.

relationships.description: Outlook III adopted Sterry to replace Sabo as his heir.

reveals.information: Outlook III is revealed to be extremely classist, viewing non-nobles as trash and being willing to threaten children's lives

keyMoments.title: Searching Gray Terminal
keyMoments.description: Young Luffy searches Gray Terminal with Ace and Sabo, expressing his desire for a telescope.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's innocent childhood desires before the tragic events unfold.

keyMoments.title: Fighting the Bluejam Pirates
keyMoments.description: Luffy fights alongside Ace and Sabo against the Bluejam Pirates before being captured.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the brothers' bond and fighting spirit even as children.

relationships.description: Luffy is Sabo's sworn brother, and Sabo sacrifices his freedom to protect him.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo sacrifices his freedom to save Luffy from being killed by the Bluejam Pirates.

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Fighting the Bluejam Pirates
keyMoments.description: Ace fights alongside Luffy and Sabo against the Bluejam Pirates before being captured.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Ace's protective nature toward his brothers even as a child.

relationships.description: Ace is Sabo's sworn brother, and Sabo sacrifices his freedom to protect him.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo sacrifices his freedom to save Ace from being killed by the Bluejam Pirates.

keyMoments.title: Bluejam Captures Sabo
keyMoments.description: Bluejam reveals he knows Sabo is a noble and surrounds him with his crew at Gray Terminal.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Bluejam's role in the nobles' plot and his knowledge of Sabo's background.
keyMoments.quote: I didn't know one of the three infamous brats was a Noble.

keyMoments.title: Battle with Three Brothers
keyMoments.description: Bluejam fights and captures all three brothers by pulling out a gun.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Bluejam's ruthlessness and willingness to harm children.

relationships.description: Bluejam was hired by Outlook III to capture Sabo and return him to High Town.

reveals.information: Bluejam knows Sabo is a noble and uses this information in his dealings with Outlook III
